result.execSummary:
The defendant James A. Brunner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MA] Case called at 1:33pm 
Defendant James A. Brunner in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1: the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10  days in Jefferson County Jail, with work release/ Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 + $25 drug testing fee= $468

On Count #2: the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10  days in Jefferson County Jail, with work release/ Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #1
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 + $25 drug testing fee= $468.

The $1000 Cash Bond is to pay costs/fees/ assessments

recess: 1:58pm

(TN)Case Called at : 1:22pm

Defendant James A. Brunner appears in custody via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is ineligible for SPD represenation. 

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Attorney Svehlek verifies the address of 815 S. 10th Street is correct. 

Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000 Cash Bond  with all previous non monetary conditions. 

Defendant informs the Court he would like to resolve the issues today. Court reviews the maximum penalties for each charge and inquires if the Defendant would still like to proceed to sentencing. 
Defendant states he would like to try and post the cash bond. 

Speedy Trial is waived by the Defendant

Recess: 1:33 pm

[MK] case called at 2:13pm. 
Defendant James A. Brunner in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court informs Attorney Huebner that it made a disclosure at the Initial Appearance regarding the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney. Attorney Huebner indicates that the Court does not need to repeat this disclosure. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.
The Court instructs the Defense to check with the JCSO regarding the booking; there is no fingerprint card in the case file at this point. 
recess 2:16pm

[MK] case called at 2:56pm
Defendant James A. Brunner in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance today, however Mr. Brunner indicates that he lost his job approximately one week ago, and he now wishes to go to the Public Defender's Office to apply for representation. 
The Court order Mr. Brunner to go to the Public Defenders Office tomorrow morning to arrange for a PD eligibility determination. 
The Court adjourns. 
recess 2:58pm. 


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 9/1/15 at 2:00pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-18-2015 02:00 pm
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 3:10pm. 
Defendant James A. Brunner in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited; Mr. Brunner waives the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Brunner indicates that he heard the Court provide information on right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given.
After Mr. Brunner indicates that he wishes to have an attorney, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $1,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no possession any needles or syringes 
--no discussion of the facts of this case with Steven Bruske
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 3:15pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 8/18/15 at 2:00pm.
